How do I use the `getaddednodeinfo` command to get a list of all nodes in the network?

The `getaddednodeinfo` command doesn't return a list of all nodes in the network. Instead, it returns information about the nodes that have been added to the local node. You can use this command to get information about a specific node by providing its IP address as an argument, or to get information about all added nodes by passing `true` as an argument.

#### Result:
```
[
 {
  "addednode" : "192.168.0.201",     (string) The node ip address
  "connected" : true|false,        (boolean) If connected
  "addresses" : [
    {
     "address" : "192.168.0.201:27485", (string) The Verus server host and port
     "connected" : "outbound"      (string) connection, inbound or outbound
    }
    ,...
   ]
 }
 ,...
]
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getaddednodeinfo true
> verus getaddednodeinfo true "192.168.0.201"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddednodeinfo", "params": [true, "192.168.0.201"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getconnectioncount`
Returns the number of connections to other nodes.#### Result:
n     (numeric) The connection countExamples:
```bash
> verus getconnectioncount
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getconnectioncount", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getdeprecationinfo`
Returns an object containing current version and deprecation block height. Applicable only on mainnet.#### Result:
```json
{
 "version": xxxxx,           (numeric) the server version
 "subversion": "/MagicBean:x.y.z[-v]/",   (string) the server subversion string
 "deprecationheight": xxxxx,      (numeric) the block height at which this version will deprecate and shut down
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getdeprecationinfo
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getdeprecationinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getnettotals`
Returns information about network traffic, including bytes in, bytes out,
and current time.
Can I use the `getdeprecationinfo` command on any network, not just mainnet?
No, the `getdeprecationinfo` command is only applicable on mainnet. It returns an object containing the current version and deprecation block height, which is specific to the mainnet.

#### Result:
```
[
 {
  "addednode" : "192.168.0.201",     (string) The node ip address
  "connected" : true|false,        (boolean) If connected
  "addresses" : [
    {
     "address" : "192.168.0.201:27485", (string) The Verus server host and port
     "connected" : "outbound"      (string) connection, inbound or outbound
    }
    ,...
   ]
 }
 ,...
]
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getaddednodeinfo true
> verus getaddednodeinfo true "192.168.0.201"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddednodeinfo", "params": [true, "192.168.0.201"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getconnectioncount`

```### `getnettotals`
Returns information about network traffic, including bytes in, bytes out,
and current time.

The `getnettotals` command returns information about network traffic, including bytes in, bytes out, and current time. It does not return information about the total number of nodes in the network, as you might have thought.

#### Result:
```
[
 {
  "addednode" : "192.168.0.201",     (string) The node ip address
  "connected" : true|false,        (boolean) If connected
  "addresses" : [
    {
     "address" : "192.168.0.201:27485", (string) The Verus server host and port
     "connected" : "outbound"      (string) connection, inbound or outbound
    }
    ,...
   ]
 }
 ,...
]
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getaddednodeinfo true
> verus getaddednodeinfo true "192.168.0.201"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddednodeinfo", "params": [true, "192.168.0.201"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getconnectioncount`
Returns the number of connections to other nodes.#### Result:
n     (numeric) The connection countExamples:
```bash
> verus getconnectioncount
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getconnectioncount", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getdeprecationinfo`
Returns an object containing current version and deprecation block height. Applicable only on mainnet.#### Result:
```json
{
 "version": xxxxx,           (numeric) the server version
 "subversion": "/MagicBean:x.y.z[-v]/",   (string) the server subversion string
 "deprecationheight": xxxxx,      (numeric) the block height at which this version will deprecate and shut down
}
```
Examples:

```### `getnettotals`
Returns information about network traffic, including bytes in, bytes out,
and current time.
